summary:
We need to produce JSON for the whole module path monai/metrics (the directory). The summary should describe overall responsibility of the metrics package: providing a collection of performance evaluation metrics for medical imaging deep learning, with cumulative/iterative interfaces, supporting segmentation, classification, regression, etc. Business intent: to enable researchers and developers to assess model quality, compare algorithms, and integrate metrics into training loops for medical imaging AI. Keywords: list of relevant terms: metric, evaluation, segmentation, classification, regression, Dice, IoU, Hausdorff, F1, F-beta, ROC AUC, SSIM, PSNR, FID, active learning, uncertainty, panoptic quality, surface distance, confusion matrix, cumulative, MONAI, medical imaging, deep learning.

Make sure not to list function names verbatim. Provide JSON with keys summary, business_intent, keywords (list). No extra text.

Let's craft.

Summary: "The monai.metrics package implements a comprehensive suite of evaluation metrics for deep learning models in medical imaging. It defines abstract base classes and concrete cumulative metric implementations covering classification (F‑beta, ROC‑AUC, confusion matrix), segmentation (Dice, IoU, Generalized Dice, Hausdorff, surface distance, Panoptic Quality), regression (MAE, MSE, RMSE, PSNR, SSIM, MS‑SSIM), generative quality (FID), active‑learning utilities (label‑quality score, variance), and wrappers for external metric libraries. Metrics can be accumulated across mini‑batches, support distributed reduction, background exclusion, multi‑class/label handling, and provide flexible reduction options."

Business intent: "Provide researchers and developers with ready‑to‑use, standardized, and extensible performance measurement tools that can be plugged into MONAI training pipelines, facilitating model validation, hyper‑parameter tuning, and reporting for medical imaging AI applications."
